hero.title: "Chinese Class" Webpage Review
hero.subtitle: Sharing AI Text-to-Image Application Exploration and Tool Comparison

section1.title: Text-to-Image for Game Assets
section1.intro: This project uses many "text-to-image" techniques and generates many specified AI images. These images are not only beautiful but also have a consistent style and continuity.
section1.text: Through this approach, content can be generated for the following types of casual games:

tip1.title: Continuous Animation Frames
tip1.content: For continuous animation frames, you can consider using "text-to-image" to generate the first image, then use "image-to-video" and extract frames. I tried this approach and it works, but there are some issues:
tip1.detail1: May generate extra elements (like motion shadows): During image-to-video conversion, AI may produce some residual dynamic shadows or elements that require additional post-processing.
tip1.detail2: Resolution loss: The video frames generated usually have lower resolution than the original image after extraction.

tip2.title: Issues Within the Same Conversation
tip2.content: In the same conversation, if you keep modifying the previously generated image through dialogue, you'll find the quality of generated images deteriorates.
tip2.solution: The solution for this situation is:
tip2.detail1: Open a new conversation each time you need to generate a specific image.
tip2.detail2: Debug that image in the new conversation separately.
tip2.detail3: Once that image is ready, open another new conversation to continue generating the next one.

section3.title: Nana Banana vs MidJourney Comparison
section3.intro: Midway through, I tried using MidJourney for images. I found Nana Banana is "smarter", while MidJourney produces better-looking results.

point1.title: Control and Logic
point1.content: MidJourney sometimes ignores real spatial logic, generating incorrect images. When you try to control the image logic with text, it's harder to manage than Nana Banana.

point2.title: Aesthetics and Effects
point2.content: MidJourney's overall aesthetics are slightly better than Nana Banana. For any simple prompt, MidJourney may generate better-looking images, but they often don't match your expectations.
